intro: Agnorhiza bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's agnorhiza, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
